Intro: I love my life. That’s the first thing that comes to my mind when I think about myself. I am a Ukrainian girl, who came to Canada for studying computer programming and developing in this sphere. I am very young, but I love each aspect of my life and my journey so far. And I want to share this love and passion with the world.
People:
People are something I love the most in life. So they deserve a special part on my website.
My amazing and loving family (parents, grandparents, sisters, aunt, uncle), who I try to call as often as I can, when ocean separates as.
PeopleSecond:
My talented and supportive friends here, in Canada, and all the close ones I consider my second family.
Also, all the wonderful friends, who are all over the world, and who I don’t see or even communicate with that much anymore, but who still takes a special place in my heart.
Of course, my amazing colleagues and team at work, who help me grow and learn more every day.
Story:
I finished Lyceum of Information Teachnologies in Dnipro, my hometown, with the gold medal as an indication of my hard work and high achievements. That’s where I was first introduced to programming, and understood that it’s my passion.
Then I moved to Kitchener, Canada to study at the Conestoga College for the Computer Programming and Analysis program.
StorySecond:
I participated in a Leadership Ambassador program during the first year of studies. For the second year I moved to Waterloo.
After it I started my co-op at the local company called Vehikl, which is a software consultancy, where I’ve learned and still am learning a lot.
Also, during my co-op, when everything was remote, my friends and I launched a Google Developer Student Club at the Conestoga, which was an incredible experience.
